title: Change snowfall effect color to red

requirements.text: Modify the SnowfallBackground component's drawSnowflake function to render snowflakes in red tones instead of white/blue by changing the radial gradient color stops from white (rgba(255, 255, 255, ...)) and light blue (rgba(240, 245, 255, ...)) to red values (e.g., rgba(255, 0, 0, ...) for the center and rgba(255, 100, 100, ...) for the outer glow)
acceptanceCriteria: Snowflakes in the SnowfallBackground component render with red gradient colors instead of white/blue
The radial gradient maintains the same opacity and structure but uses red color values
The snowfall animation continues to work with the same speed, drift, and particle behavior as before
Both normal and reduced-motion modes continue to function correctly with red snowflakes

constraints: Do not modify the snowfall animation logic, particle density, speed ranges (0.25-1 px/frame), or accessibility features (prefers-reduced-motion support)
Do not change the SnowfallBackground component's canvas rendering infrastructure, devicePixelRatio handling, or resize behavior
Only modify the color values in the drawSnowflake function's gradient creation
nonGoals: Changing the background component from SnowfallBackground to another animation type
Modifying the snowfall particle count, size ranges, or drift behavior
Adding color customization controls or theme integration
Changing any other visual elements beyond the snowflake color itself
